Summary: I want to configurate the delay time for external communication during extreme weather
Description:
*As* a user,

*I want* to manually configurate a delay time in minutes to postpone the 1^st^ notification to external during extreme weather

*So that* the engineering team can have more time to handle the outage before communication.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can log in and navigate to Administration → Settings → Delay Control (Stage 1) section.

*AC2*: The current Delay Before External Send (Minutes) is displayed clearly, the time is calculated when first notification is sent (i.e. Assume 5mins after outage reported).

*AC3*: The admin can edit the Delay Before External Notification Send under +*Extreme Weather*+ (Minutes), only positive integer is allowed.

*AC4*: After editing, the admin clicks a “Save” button to apply changes.

*AC5*: The system provides confirmation feedback after successfully update, such as “Delay Time have been updated successfully”

*AC6*: The updated Delay Before External Send (Minutes) is saved correctly and persists after page refresh or next login.

!image-20250929-040141.png|width=679,alt="image-20250929-040141.png"!

Summary: I want to enable the extreme weather mode to delay the external communication
Description:
*As* a user,

*I want* to manually enable the extreme weather mode

*So that* the system will postpone the 1^st^ notification to external during extreme weather



*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can log in and navigate to Administration → Settings → Trigger Mode section.

*AC2*: The current Extreme Weather Mode status is displayed clearly.

*AC3*: The admin can turn it on and off the Extreme Weather Mode toggle.

*AC4*: System pop-up a message box to warn the admin will continue to send out all ongoing messages. 

✅ Decision: Continue to send all ongoing notification messages even if there is weather change. (For example: Extreme weather ↔ Normal weather)

*AC5*: The system will send the Extreme Weather message [https://clpdigital.atlassian.net/browse/EP-97|https://clpdigital.atlassian.net/browse/EP-97|smart-link] instead of Normal Weather message when the Extreme Weather mode is on.

*AC6*: When the extreme weather → Message body is empty for selected template, system will send the message for normal weather.

Summary: Configurable time between the first notification & the second notification
Description:
*As* an admin user,

*I want* to manually configurate the expected max time between the first notification and the second notification (stage 3)

*So that* CAs who fails to receive the updated information will trigger alter to notify alert group users



*Acceptance Criteria*:

*AC1:* The admin can log in and navigate to Administration → Settings section → Alert Message Triggering.

*AC2*: The current alert time between stage 1 & stage 3 (minutes) is displayed clearly, the time is calculated when 1^st^ internal notification is sent.

*AC3*: The admin can edit the alert time (minutes) and only positive integers is valid. If not, there will be error message to remind the user to correct the input.

*AC4*: After the user clicks “Save”, the update alert time (minutes) is saved correctly and persists after page refresh or next login.

*AC5*: The update will not be saved, if the user clicks “Cancel”.

*AC6:* System generate an email to alert group with excel attached to show the affected customer without second notification (stage 3) per incident.

Summary: Alert Group
Description:
*As* an admin user,

*I want to* configurate the alert group so that people in this group can receive e-mail notification (alert message) when affected CAs who can’t receive the second notification (stage 3) after the first notification is sent within defined time range

*So that* I can deal with the delay issue quickly and update the following notification as soon as possible. 

*Acceptance Criteria*:

*AC1*: After the user click the “Add New Role” button, each permission except “Receive Alert Message” of Alert Group can be changed. If the user clicks save, the changes will be saved and updated. If the user clicks cancel, the changes will be cancelled.

*AC2*: The permission “Receive Alert Message” is mandatory for Alert Group and cannot be changed.

*AC3:* Every time the alert message is triggered, it will be sent to users in Alert Group.

Summary: Setting: Enable/Disable Internal Communication
Description:
As an admin,
I want to be able to enable or disable internal communication,
So that the system’s internal communication behavior can be controlled as needed.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can log into the E2E outage platform and navigate to Administration → Settings section.

*AC2:* The current status of the internal communication toggle (enabled or disabled) is displayed clearly.

*AC3:* The admin can toggle the internal communication setting on or off.

*AC4:* After toggling, the admin clicks the “Save” button to apply the change.

*AC5:* If toggling internal communication impacts active processes, the system warns the admin before saving changes. The warning should include “Existing active communication will be terminated immediately”

*AC6:* The updated internal communication status is saved correctly and persists after page refresh or subsequent logins.

*AC7:* The system provides a confirmation message indicating that the internal communication setting has been updated successfully.

*AC8:* All the active communication process will also be terminated immediately after communication setting has been updated successfully.

!image-20250819-080308.png|width=1110,height=594,alt="image-20250819-080308.png"!

Summary: Role Management: delete role
Description:
As an admin,
I want to delete a specific role
So that obsolete or unnecessary roles can be removed to maintain a clean and secure role management system in the E2E platform.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Administration module and access the Roles section.

*AC2:* The admin can select a specific role from the roles list to delete.

*AC3:* Clicking the “Delete” button prompts a confirmation dialog asking the admin to confirm or cancel the deletion.

*AC4:* If the admin confirms, the role is deleted from the system.

*AC5:* The system prevents deletion of any default or critical system roles and informs the admin accordingly.

*AC6:* If the role is assigned to any users, the system warns the admin and either prevents deletion or requires reassignment of those users before proceeding.

*AC7:* After successful deletion, the deleted role no longer appears in the roles list.

*AC8:* The system displays a confirmation message stating the role has been deleted successfully.

*AC10:* After deletion, the users originally assigned to this role will become inactive if no new role is assigned

Summary: Setting: Configurate the max number of update
Description:
As an admin,
I want to limit the number of updates between first interim and final restoration
So that the system prevents excessive updates

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The system enforces a configurable maximum number of updates allowed between interim and final update.

*AC2:* If the update limit is reached, further auto-updates are blocked

*AC3:* The admin receives a clear notification when the update limit has been reached and further updates are paused.

*AC4:* The update limit settings are configurable by the admin via the Settings page.

Summary: Settings: Opt-out/Opt-in customer by upload file
Description:
As an admin,
I want to bulk update opt-in/out statuses via CSV upload
So that I can save time for updating opt-in/out status for multiple customers 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Setting section.

*AC2:* The admin can download a sample CSV template containing columns for Customer Account (CA) and Opt-in/Out action.

*AC3:* The admin can upload a CSV file following the sample format with CA and desired opt-in or opt-out status for each customer.

*AC4:* Upon uploading, the system validates the CSV file for required columns, proper formatting, and existence of customer accounts.

*AC5:* Clicking the “Save” button applies the opt-in/out status changes from the CSV file to the corresponding customers.

*AC6:* The system displays a summary report indicating the number of successful updates and any errors encountered with details.

*AC7:* The System sends details of the summary report to admin

*AC8:* The updated opt-in/out statuses are immediately reflected in the customer records.

*AC9:* The system displays a confirmation message after successful bulk update.

*AC10*: The system sends the summary report via e-mail indicating the number of successful updates and any errors encountered with details to admin

Summary: Settings: Opt-out/Opt-in customer by manual input
Description:
As an admin,
I want to manually set opt-in or opt-out status for customers
So that customer communication preferences can be managed accurately.

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Settings section.

*AC2:* The admin can manually input one Customer Accounts (CA) identifiers.

*AC3:* The admin can select an opt-in or opt-out toggle for the specified customers.

*AC4:* Clicking the “Save” button saves the changes to the customers’ opt-in/out statuses.

*AC5:* The updated opt-in/out statuses are immediately reflected in the customer records.

*AC6:* The admin receives a confirmation message after successfully saving the opt-in/out status updates.

*AC7:* The admin can only opt-in or opt-out one customer per each manual operation 

!image-20250827-014946.png|width=1102,height=595,alt="image-20250827-014946.png"!

Summary: Settings: Set external notification delay
Description:
As an admin,
I want to configure a delay for external notifications after sending notifications to internal stakeholders
So that external communications are appropriately timed following internal alerts.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Delay & Control section within the administration settings.

*AC2:* The current delay value for external notifications is displayed clearly to the admin.

*AC3:* The admin can edit the delay interval (e.g., time in minutes) for external notifications.

*AC4:* Upon clicking the “Save” button, the updated delay is saved and applied immediately.

*AC5:* The updated delay value persists after page refresh or subsequent logins.

*AC6:* The system validates the delay input to ensure it is within acceptable ranges (e.g., minimum zero or positive integer).

*AC7:* The system displays a confirmation message indicating the delay setting has been updated successfully.

*AC8:* While the delay is active, the system sends internal notifications immediately and holds external notifications until the delay time has elapsed.

*AC9:* If the delay is changed while notifications are pending, the new delay setting takes effect for subsequent notifications only.

Summary: Settings: Set trigger mode
Description:
As an admin,
I want to enable or disable trigger modes for notifications
So that I can control whether notifications are sent automatically or manually in the E2E platform.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the “Trigger Mode” section after logging in.

*AC2:* The admin can see toggle switches for both “Auto Trigger” and “Manual Trigger” modes.

*AC3:* The admin can independently toggle “Auto Trigger” and “Manual Trigger” modes on or off.

*AC4:* After adjusting the toggles, the admin can click the “Save” button to apply changes.

*AC5:* The system saves the updated trigger mode settings and applies them immediately.

*AC6:* The system displays a confirmation message indicating that the trigger mode settings have been successfully updated.

!image-20250818-035433.png|width=1110,height=601,alt="image-20250818-035433.png"!

Summary: Setting: Enable/Disable External Communication
Description:
As an admin,
I want to be able to enable or disable external communication
So that the system’s communication behavior can be controlled as needed.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can log into the E2E outage platform and navigate to Administration → Settings section.

*AC2:* The current status of the external communication toggle (enabled or disabled) is displayed clearly.

*AC3:* The admin can toggle the external communication setting on or off.

*AC4:* After toggling, the admin clicks the “Save” button to apply the change.

*AC5:* The updated external communication status is saved correctly and persists after page refresh or subsequent logins.

*AC6:* The system provides a confirmation message indicating that the external communication setting has been updated successfully.

*AC7:* If toggling external communication impacts active processes, the system warns the admin before saving changes.

*AC8:* All the active communication process will also be terminated immediately after communication setting has been updated successfully.

Summary: Setting: Configure Auto-Update Interval
Description:
As an admin,
I want to check and edit the auto-update interval
So that the interim notification frequency aligns with operational needs.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can log into the E2E outage platform and navigate to Administration → Settings.

*AC2:* The current auto-update interval value is displayed clearly to the admin.

*AC3:* The admin can edit the auto-update interval value in an input field.

*AC4:* The admin can click the “Save” button to save the updated auto-update interval.

*AC5:* The updated auto-update interval value is saved correctly and persists after page refresh or subsequent logins.

*AC6:* The system validates the interval input to ensure it is within allowed limits (e.g., positive integer, minimum/maximum thresholds), and show error msg if input is incorrect

*AC7:* The system displays a confirmation message after successfully saving the updated interval.

Summary: Setting: Configure Data Retention Period
Description:
As an admin,
I want to check and edit the data retention period of Customer data in SharePoint as well as outage data in the E2E platform
So that the system retains data according to current compliance and business requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can log in and navigate to Administration → Settings section.

*AC2:* The current data retention periods for both Customer data (stored in SharePoint) and outage data (in the E2E platform) are displayed clearly.

*AC3:* The admin can edit the data retention period values for both Customer data and outage data.

*AC4:* After editing, the admin clicks a “Save” button to apply changes.

*AC5:* The updated data retention periods are saved correctly and persist after page refresh or next login.

*AC6:* The system validates that retention period values are within acceptable ranges (e.g., positive integers with upper limit).

*AC7:* The system provides confirmation feedback after successful update, such as “Data retention periods have been updated successfully.”

Summary: Role Management: create new role
Description:
As an admin,
I want to add a new role
So that I can define custom access permissions for new user groups in the E2E platform.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Administration module and open the Roles section.

*AC2:* The admin can click an “Add New Role” button to start creating a new role.

*AC3:* The system displays a form with an input field for the role name and a list of permissions with toggles or checkboxes, similar to existing roles.

*AC4:* The admin enters a unique role name and selects the desired permissions from the list.

*AC5:* Clicking the “Save” button creates the new role with the specified name and permissions.

*AC6:* The new role appears immediately in the list of roles.

*AC7:* The system confirms role creation by displaying a message such as “Role [Role Name] has been created successfully.”

*AC8:* The system validates that the role name is unique and not empty; if invalid, it displays an error and prevents saving.

*AC9:* The permissions assigned to the new role take effect immediately.

!image-20250822-013056.png|width=1216,height=671,alt="image-20250822-013056.png"!

Summary: Role Management: Edit each role
Description:
As an admin,
I want to modify the name and permission associated with each role
So that all roles can have correct access to E2E platform

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin user can log in and navigate to the Administration module, then to the Roles section.

*AC2:* The admin can select any role from the roles list to edit.

*AC3:* Upon selecting a role, the system displays the current role name in an editable input field.

*AC4:* The system displays a comprehensive list of permissions as toggles or checkboxes for features/modules such as:

* Full Dashboard Access
* Outage Management
* Emergency Stop
* User Administration
* Template Management
* Send Notifications
* Receive Notifications
* Access Residential Customer Information
* Access Non-Residential Customer Information
* Download Data
* Receive Outage Notification

*AC5:* The admin can edit the role name as needed.

*AC6:* The admin can toggle on or off any permissions for the role.

*AC7:* Clicking the “Save” button saves both the updated role name and the updated permission settings.

*AC8:* The updated role name and permissions take effect immediately across the platform.

*AC9:* The system displays a confirmation message: “Permissions for role [Updated Role Name] have been updated.”

*AC10:* The system validates that the new role name is unique and not empty before saving changes.

*AC11:* If the role name is invalid (e.g., duplicate or blank), the system displays an appropriate error message and prevents saving.

!image-20250903-062537.png|width=1147,height=614,alt="image-20250903-062537.png"!

Summary: Role Management: Display role list
Description:
As an admin,
I want to view all roles and their permissions in the platform
So that I can understand the permissions assigned to each role and manage them effectively.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Roles section after logging in.

*AC2:* The admin can view a complete list of all roles in the platform.

*AC3:* For each role, the list clearly displays the associated access permissions.

*AC4:* Display the #of active users of each role

!image-20250818-034219.png|width=1132,height=619,alt="image-20250818-034219.png"!

Summary: User Management: adding multiple users via CSV upload
Description:
As an admin user,
I want to add multiple users by uploading a CSV file
so that I can save time when onboarding new users to the E2E outage platform

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Users section and see an option/button to “Upload CSV” for adding users in bulk.

*AC2:* Clicking the “Upload CSV” button opens a file selection dialog allowing the admin to choose a CSV file.

*AC3:* The system accepts CSV files that contain mandatory fields such as staffID, and role in a specified format.

*AC4:* After selecting a valid CSV file, the system validates the file format and data.

*AC5:* If validation fails (e.g., missing fields, invalid email format, duplicate entries), the system displays detailed error messages for each issue identified, and the upload is rejected.

*AC6:* If validation succeeds, the system adds all valid users from the CSV with default status set to “Active.”

*AC7:* Newly added users appear in the user list immediately upon successful upload.

*AC8:* The admin can cancel the upload process before confirmation without adding users.

*AC9:* The system prevents uploading of users who already exist (identified by staffID) and notifies the admin accordingly.

*AC10*: to show the sample CSV for download and edit, and upload to make sure user use the right format

Summary: User Management: Identify user by search name/e-mail
Description:
As an admin,
I want to search users by names and emails
So that I can quickly find a specific user in the E2E outage platform.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* The admin can see a search input box prominently placed in the Users section.

*AC2:* The admin can enter a full or partial name or email address into the search box.

*AC3:* As the admin types, the user list dynamically updates to display users whose name or email matches the search term (case-insensitive, partial match allowed).

*AC4:* The admin can submit the search by pressing Enter or clicking a “Search” button (if applicable).

*AC5:* If no matching users are found, the user list displays an appropriate message such as “No users found.”

*AC6:* Clearing the search input or clicking a “Clear” button restores the full user list.

*AC7:* The search feature supports searching across both first and last names as well as complete email addresses.

*AC8:* Search results respect any other applied filters (e.g., Role or Status filtering combined with search).

Summary: User Management: Identify user by filter
Description:
*As* an admin,
*I* want to filter users by roles and status
*So that* I can find the specific user quickly

Acceptance Criteria

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to the Users section and see a “Filter” icon near the Role and Status columns.

*AC2:* When the admin clicks the “Filter” icon near Role or Status, a filtering popup appears.

*AC3:* The filtering popup allows the admin to select filter criteria—for example, select one or multiple Roles and/or Status values.

*AC4:* The admin can apply the filter by clicking an “Apply” button in the popup.

*AC5:* After applying the filter, the user list updates to show only users that match the selected Role(s) and/or Status(es).

*AC6:* The admin can clear the filter criteria and see the full user list again by clicking a “Clear” or “Reset” button.

*AC7:* The system allows combination filters (e.g., filtering by Role = "Admin" and Status = "Active" simultaneously).

*AC8:* If no users match the filter criteria, the user list displays an appropriate message such as “No users found.”

!image-20250818-032905.png|width=1106,height=591,alt="image-20250818-032905.png"!

Summary: User Management: Delete existing user
Description:
*As* an admin,
*I want* to delete existing users
*So that* I can remove outdated or unauthorized accounts from the E2E outage platform and maintain a clean and secure user environment.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1:* Clicking the “Delete” button opens a confirmation dialog asking the admin to confirm or cancel the deletion.

*AC2:* If the admin confirms deletion, the selected user is permanently removed from the system and no longer appears in the user list.

*AC3:* If the admin cancels, the deletion does not proceed and the user remains in the list unchanged.

*AC4:* The system prevents the admin from deleting their own user account to avoid accidental self-removal.

*AC5:* After successful deletion, the admin receives a feedback message confirming the user has been deleted.

*AC6:* Deleted users immediately lose access to the E2E outage platform.

Summary: User Management: Disable/enable User
Description:
*As* an admin,

*I want* to disable or enable users

*So that* only necessary user can access E2E outage platform

Acceptance Criteria

*AC1:* The admin can view the user list with each user’s current status displayed.

*AC2:* For users with status “Active,” the action buttons shown are “Edit” and “Disable.”

*AC3:* For users with status “Inactive,” the action buttons shown are “Edit” and “Enable.”

*AC4:* Clicking the “Disable” button changes the user’s status from “Active” to “Inactive.”

*AC5:* Once disabled, the user is blocked from logging into the E2E outage platform.

*AC6:* Once enabled, the user is allowed to log into the platform according to their assigned role.

*AC7:* The change in user status is immediately reflected in the user list.

*AC8*: The system should pop up a msg “user [name] has been disabled” 

!image-20250818-031918.png|width=1146,height=631,alt="image-20250818-031918.png"!

Summary: User Management: Edit user information
Description:
*As* an admin,

*I want* to edit user information

*So tha*t E2E platform can keep latest user information

Acceptance Criteria

*AC1:* The admin user can navigate to the Users page.

*AC2:* The admin can click the “Edit” button on any user record.

*AC3:* When “Edit” is clicked on a user record, the “Edit”, “Delete”, and “Disable/Enable” buttons for that user are replaced by “Save” and “Cancel” buttons.

*AC4:* The admin can edit the user’s role fields only; the name and email field are not editable.

*AC5:* When the admin clicks “Save,” the updated user information is saved and immediately reflected in the user list.

*AC6:* When the admin clicks “Cancel,” any changes made are discarded, and the buttons revert back to “Edit” and “Disable/Enable.”

!image-20250818-021320.png|width=1154,height=624,alt="image-20250818-021320.png"!

Summary: User Management: Add new user
Description:
*As* an admin,
*I want* to be able to add new user when needed
*So tha*t new stakeholders can use E2E outage platform.

Acceptance Criteria

*AC1:* The admin can navigate to Administration > Users after logging in with admin privileges.

*AC2:* The admin can see and click the “+ Add New User” button on the Users tab.

*AC3:* Clicking the “+ Add New User” button opens a popup form with input fields and “Cancel” and “Create” buttons.

*AC4:* When the admin inputs a valid [staffID], the system auto-fills the corresponding [name] and [e-mail] fields in the popup.

*AC5:* The admin can edit or confirm the auto-filled information before creating the user.

*AC6:* Clicking “Create” adds the new user to the system with a default status of “Active.”

*AC7:* The newly added user appears in the first row of the user list immediately after creation.

*AC8:* The new user gains access to the platform according to the assigned role.

*AC9:* Clicking “Cancel” closes the popup without adding a new user or making any changes.

!image-20250822-012143.png|width=486,height=529,alt="image-20250822-012143.png"!

Summary: User Management: Display user list
Description:
*As* an admin,
*I want* to have the full list of users in E2E outage platform under “Users” tab
*So that* I will know who is using the platform, enabling me to manage roles, monitor access, and ensure the right stakeholders are engaged during outage communication and resolution.



*Acceptance Criteria*

*AC1:* The admin user can access the "Users" tab under the Administration section after logging in.

*AC2:* The "Users" tab displays a complete list of all users in the E2E outage platform in alphabetical order

*AC3:* For each user in the list, the following details are visible: name, email, role, status, and last login time.

*AC4:* The admin user can see action buttons for each user: “Edit”, “Delete”, and “Disable/Enable.”

*AC5:* The admin user can successfully perform the following actions using the buttons: edit user details, disable or enable a user account, and delete a user if needed.

Summary: Provide Message Templates for Different Channels
Parent summary: Configure Message Template with Defined Variables
Description:
As a user, I want to create and manage message templates for different communication channels so that content is optimized for each channel's format.

AC:

Summary: incidentUsagePoints for New and other status incidents does not match
Description:
*Cause:*

Due to the system design or limitation of ADMS, it might not have UsagePoint for interim update. As a result, E2E don’t know who to inform for interim update.



*Case Study:*

0:00 - Outage occurred

0:03 - Receive verified event from MSV, with {{incident}} + {{UsagePoint}}, affected customer (meter ID) = 10.

0:10 - Interim update by PSBG, with {{incident}} data but no {{UsagePoint}}.



*Potential Handling:*

* Use the {{UsagePoint}} for new outage (Incident status = NEW) to recognize the affected customer to be informed. 



*Decision:*

* Discard interim update and send alerts to stakeholders for acknowledgement.
* Send the Stage 3: power restoration notification as remaining journey.

Summary: Receive fully Restore event after the PartiallyRestore event
Description:
*Cause:*

* Large incident impact multiple affected customer which PSBG restored power to partially and update the status in ADMS as power status = Partially Restore.
* And PSBG would update the power status = Restored after the power is fully restored.

 

*Case Study:*

* An incident having 2000 affected customers.
* 1500 of them are restored, and PSBG update Power status = Partially Restored.
* Send stage 3 notification to those *1500* customers
* Send stage 3 notification to remaining *500* customers when PSBG update Power status = Restored.

 

*Potential Handling:*

* Send notification only to the restored customers when Power Status update from {{Partially Restored}} → {{Restored}}, by finding difference between the UsagePoints of {{PartialRestore}} and stage 1 initial {{New}} list (Incident status = New).

 

*Decision:*

* Agreed with handling.
* When multiple partially restored, send “delta” for each notification. For example: Partially restore 1 = 1500,  partially restore 2 = 300,  then remaining 200 when Power Status update from {{Partially Restored}} → {{Restored}}.

Summary: Power Status become PartialRestore (PartialRestore is the Stage 3 condition)
Description:
*Cause:*

* Large incident impact multiple affected customer which PSBG restored power to partially and update the status in ADMS as Power Status = Partially Restore.



*Case Study:*

* An incident having *2000* affected customers.
* 1500 of them are restored, and PSBG update Power status = Partially Restored.
* Send stage 3 notification to those *1500* customers



*Potential Handling:*

* Send stage 3: Power restore notification only to the “restored customers” by using the UsagePoints of {{PartiallyRestored}}. 



*Decision:*

* Agreed with the handling.
* When multiple partially restored, send “delta” for each notification.

Summary: Deviation – interim happens after power restored
Description:
*Cause:*

* Could happen if the incident has not gone to “Field Completed”, but the same customers are affected by an outage again.
* Can be identified if incident status goes to “Site Restored” or Power Status goes to “Restored” / “Partially Restored”; then incident status changes back to “Dispatched” or “In Progress” and/or Power Status changes back to an outage status.



*Case study:*

0:00 - Outage occurred.

0:10 - PSBG completed repair, update Incident status = Site Restored OR Power Status = Restored.

0:12 - Before closing the incident (-> Incident status = Field Completed), outage occurred again.

0:13 - PSBG assign job, and incident status is update back to “Dispatch” or “In Progress”.

!image-20251106-063733.png|width=667,alt="image-20251106-063733.png"!

*Potential handling:*

# Complete the original journey (Stage 1/2/3), and continue stage 2/3 on same incident (Interim update → Power restoration).
## Optional: If stage 1 message needed when outage occurred again?

||*Event*||*E2E comm. journey*||*Status update*||
|Outage occurred|Stage 1|Incident status = New|
|Interim update|Stage 2|{{ATA}} is updated|
|Power Restored|Stage 3|Incident status = Site Restored *OR*
Power status = Restored|
|Outage occurred again before updating {{Incident status = Field Completed}}|Stage 2|Incident status = Dispatched or In Progress|
|Power Restored again|Stage 3|Incident status = Site Restored *OR*
Power status = Restored|

# Discard the “interim update” & “power restoration” for same incident which Incident status = Site Restored goes back to “In Progress” Or “Dispatch”. 
#* Optional: Add if logic (ETR for 2nd outage > xx mins). The purpose is we still need to inform customer if the new outage can’t resolve in short period of time



*Decision:*

* Expect customer to have completed communication journey (Stage 1/2/3) when incidents happen again.

Summary: Deviation – interim first before the New Outage
Description:
*Cause:*

* Could happen if Interim update happens while new outage is still under 3-minute checking by MSV (or network/kafka issue)
* Can be identified when the incident status is not “New” but the incident ID has not been seen before



*Case study:*

0:00 - Outage occurred

0:02 - Interim update by PSBG (E.g. ATA is updated)

0:03 - Outage verified by MSV, send JSON to E2E (Incident status = New)

Which “interim update” is earlier than “new outage notification”.

!image-20251104-082847.png|width=688,alt="image-20251104-082847.png"!

*Potential handling:*

# When this “interim update” happened, wait xx minutes if there is “new outage notification”.
#* True: Send “New outage notification” & “Interim update” by sequence.
#* False: Send the “Interim update” and follow the rest journey for stage 3 (Power restoration). Discard the “New outage notification” if receive later.
# Send the interim update as normal, then discard the “new outage notification“ and follow the rest journey for stage 3 (Power restoration).
# Discard the interim update.



*Decision:*

Option 1, with below timeline of how system operates:

||*Time*||*Detail*||*Notification*||
|0:00|Outage occurred, MSV is verifying the event| |
|0:02|PSBG arrived, update ATA in ADMS| |
| |Wait 5 minutes for “new outage notification”|Hold Stage 2 notification|
|0:07|Received verified “new outage” from MSV|# Send Stage 1 notification|
| | |# Send Stage 2 notification|
